title: ElectroBeez branding, blue/white theme refresh, contact details, and domain setup documentation

requirements.summary: Add ElectroBeez logo as the brand mark in header navigation and also display it in the hero and footer sections using static frontend assets.
acceptanceCriteria: The header navigation (frontend/src/components/landing/SectionNav.tsx) shows the ElectroBeez logo in place of the current icon/brand mark.
The hero section (frontend/src/components/landing/LandingPage.tsx) includes the ElectroBeez logo in a visually prominent, responsive placement.
The footer section of the landing page includes the ElectroBeez logo (or a compact variant) with appropriate sizing and spacing.
Logo images are referenced as static assets from the frontend (not served from the backend).

file_operations.description: Add the generated transparent square ElectroBeez logo asset at this exact path so it can be referenced as a static frontend asset.
Add the generated transparent horizontal ElectroBeez logo lockup asset at this exact path so it can be referenced as a static frontend asset.
Add the generated transparent favicon-sized ElectroBeez icon at this exact path so it can be referenced as a static frontend asset.

Replace the current Zap icon/brand text with the ElectroBeez logo (prefer the horizontal lockup) using the static asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/electrobeez-logo-horizontal.dim_1200x300.png; ensure responsive sizing and accessible alt text. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add the ElectroBeez logo into the hero section (use frontend/public/assets/generated/electrobeez-logo.dim_512x512.png or the horizontal lockup as appropriate) in a prominent, responsive placement; add the logo into the landing page footer area as well. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Update the app favicon reference to use the generated asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/electrobeez-favicon.dim_64x64.png.

requirements.summary: Switch the entire site theme to a professional blue-and-white palette by updating global theme tokens and refactoring landing page styling to avoid monochrome hard-coded utilities.
acceptanceCriteria: Global theme tokens in frontend/src/index.css are updated from monochrome neutrals to a blue-and-white palette for both :root and .dark variables (background/foreground/primary/secondary/accent/border/ring/etc).

Hard-coded monochrome utility styling in landing components (e.g., zinc/black gradients and text colors in frontend/src/components/landing/LandingPage.tsx and frontend/src/components/landing/SectionNav.tsx) is refactored so the UI consistently reflects the blue-and-white theme.
Primary call-to-action buttons and key accents use the new blue primary color (and remain accessible with sufficient contrast).
No section reverts to the old monochrome look after the change (hero, donate, about, budget, benefits, navigation, footer).

file_operations.description: Replace the current monochrome OKLCH variable set with a blue-and-white palette for both light (:root) and dark (.dark) modes, covering background/foreground/card/popover/primary/secondary/muted/accent/destructive/border/input/ring/chart tokens.

Refactor navigation styles to use theme tokens (e.g., bg-background, text-foreground, border-border, and primary accents) instead of zinc/black hard-coded classes; ensure CTA button uses the new primary blue styling consistently. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Refactor hero, donate, about, budget, benefits, and footer section styling to remove hard-coded zinc/black gradients and text colors, aligning all sections with the updated blue-and-white theme tokens and accessible contrast. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add ElectroBeez contact email and phone number to the landing page (at minimum in the footer) with clickable mailto and tel links and theme-consistent styling.
acceptanceCriteria: The footer includes the email and phone number displayed as text and as clickable links (mailto:electrobeezindia@gmail.com and tel:+918638493216).
If contact details are included in the header, they remain responsive (do not overflow on mobile) and are accessible.
The contact details are visible in both light mode and dark mode and match the new blue-and-white palette.

file_operations.description: Add footer contact details for ElectroBeez (email electrobeezindia@gmail.com and phone +918638493216) as visible text plus clickable mailto:electrobeezindia@gmail.com and tel:+918638493216 links; ensure styling matches the new theme in both light/dark modes. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Optionally add compact contact links in the header (or mobile menu) in a responsive, non-overflowing layout; ensure accessibility (focus states, readable contrast) and theme consistency. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add in-repo documentation guiding custom domain setup for an Internet Computer canister-hosted site with explicit DOMAIN and CANISTER_ID placeholders.
acceptanceCriteria: A new documentation file exists (e.g., DOMAIN_SETUP.md or README section) describing the steps to map a custom domain to an IC canister-hosted website, including what DNS records to set and where to provide the canister ID.
Instructions include explicit placeholders for DOMAIN and CANISTER_ID (without guessing the userâ€™s domain).
Documentation clarifies which steps are external to the codebase (domain registrar/DNS and boundary node configuration) vs. what is in-repo.

file_operations.description: Create a custom domain setup guide for Internet Computer hosting that explains (1) DNS records to configure, (2) where/how to provide the canister ID, and (3) boundary node/custom domain configuration steps, using explicit placeholders DOMAIN and CANISTER_ID and clearly separating external steps from in-repo steps.
